backend/main.mo: Motoko backend with access control providing movie CRUD operations, user profiles, and pagination.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing PWA, service worker, and install-help features with related files and components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text file containing prewritten summaries for many frontend source files.
frontend/docs/publishing.md: Guide describing how to publish Draft to Live, verify backend status, and troubleshoot common deployment issues.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles defining theme variables for light/dark modes and applying global background and text colors.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry page including PWA manifest, icons, theme color, and root mount point for the React app.
frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest: Web app manifest defining PWA metadata including name, colors, start URL, display mode, and app icons.
frontend/public/sw.js: Service worker implementing install, activate, and fetch handlers for app-shell caching and offline fallback.
frontend/QA-delete-button-ownership.md: Manual QA checklist verifying proper Delete button visibility based on movie ownership and login state.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root app component handling theme, service worker registration, layout, and routing of genre selection into MovieGrid.
frontend/src/components/AddMovieDialog.t: Dialog for creating a new movie with fields, genre management, photo uploads, auth checks, and submit logic.
frontend/src/components/AuthControls.tsx: Authentication button handling Internet Identity login/logout and cache clearing.
Autoplays looping synthwave audio with mute/unmute control and interaction fallback.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Retro‑styled footer showing credits and links to publishing and install help dialogs.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Header showing app title, genre selector, authentication controls, and an add‑movie trigger with auth checks.
frontend/src/components/InstallHelpDialo: Dialog explaining how to install the PWA on Android and iOS with step‑by‑step instructions.
frontend/src/components/MovieCard.tsx: Displays a movie with image cycling, details click handler, and owner‑restricted delete action.
frontend/src/components/MovieDetailDialo: Displays a modal with movie details and photo navigation including keyboard and swipe controls.
frontend/src/components/MovieGrid.tsx: Renders a paginated or filtered movie grid with loading, offline handling, and a detail dialog.
frontend/src/components/PaginationContro: Provides numbered pagination buttons with ellipsis logic and active state styling.
frontend/src/components/PublishingHelpDi: Shows a help dialog explaining publishing steps and troubleshooting guidance.
frontend/src/components/VHSEffects.tsx: Applies animated VHS-style visual effects using a canvas overlay and background images.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor and invalidates dependent queries on change.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Manages Internet Identity authentication state, login flow, stored identity loading, and provides related context.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Provides React Query hooks to fetch movies, pagination info, genres, and genre-filtered results with actor-dependent loading state adjustments.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles and custom 1980s neon-themed color variables and utilities.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Initializes the React app, wrapping it with React Query and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/src/utils/errors.ts: Normalizes backend errors into readable user-facing messages with specific handling for common failure types.
frontend/src/utils/movieOwnership.ts: Exports a helper to check whether the current user is the creator of a movie.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides helpers for reading, persisting, and clearing URL parameters using query strings, hash routing, and session storage.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind with custom neon color variables, extended utilities, container settings, and plugins.
project_state.json: Stores project metadata, feature requirements, PWA-related tasks, and overall project state information.
